Register Now        Request Information        Events                                                                  Whether your goal is to move ahead in your career, change your professional direction, or deepen your appreciation of the humanities, arts, and writing, you’ll find a rich array of noncredit courses and certificates from which to choose. Explore subjects that stir your imagination with faculty members who are eager to share their expertise and their passion. Enjoy the intellectual stimulation of a vibrant learning community.           Ready to Proceed?        Register for Courses Now                 Noncredit Courses        Whether analyzing an artistic masterpiece, taking in a theatrical performance, or immersing yourself in a creative writing project, studying the world's greatest forms of human expression provides an ideal way to broaden your horizons. Through thought-provoking discussion and intellectual exploration, the NYU School of Professional Studies continuing education courses in the humanities and the performing arts help you to sharpen your critical thinking skills, engage in cultural discovery, and communicate with diverse audiences.   Our courses in literature, film, theater, performing arts, history, archaeology, philosophy, and religion can spark your curiosity and challenge you to view the world from a fresh perspective. Read and discuss great books. Discover the masters of American cinema or become engrossed in the work of modern European philosophers. Explore New York City's theater scene as an audience member or take to the stage in one of our many acting and performance courses.            A Selection of Courses From This Department                                              Appraisal of Historical Textiles and Clothing                                                            Great Choral Compositions in Classical Music                                                            Independent Study in Photography                                                            Literature and Film Go Back to High School                                                            Manhattan's Residential Secrets                                                            Writing Film Dialogue                                                                               View all Humanities, Arts, and Writing Noncredit Courses           Certificates        If you’re seeking an effective way to move your career forward, earning a noncredit certificate through the NYU School of Professional Studies allows you to acquire proficiency in a specific professional arena. Designed to accommodate the schedules of busy professionals, certificate programs offer in-depth knowledge and unique insights into subject matter, allowing you to gain significant expertise and industry-specific skills. This powerful credential can help you to achieve your career goals and greatly enhance your résumé. Poetry Reading: Contemporary Brazilian Poetry and Translation                  Poetry Reading: Contemporary Brazilian Poetry and Translation     Yusef Komunyakaa won the 1994 Pulitzer Prize for Poetry for Neon Vernacular. He is the Senior Distinguished Poet in the Graduate Writing Program at NYU.    Idra Novey’s most recent poetry collection is Clarice: The Visitor. She is the translator of Clarice Lispector’s novel The Passion According to G.H., and teaches in the Creative Writing Program at Princeton University.    Flávia Rocha is a Brazilian writer and journalist. Her most recent poetry collection is Quartos Habitáveis, published in Brazil. She is the editor-in-chief of Rattapallax magazine.    Márcio-André is a Brazilian experimental artist with works in sound, visual poetry, installation, performance and video art. His most recent poetry book is Cazas, published in Brazil. He has taught at the University of Coimbra and at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro.        Poetry Reading: Contemporary Brazilian Poetry and Translation      Yusef Komunyakaa won the 1994 Pulitzer Prize for Poetry for Neon Vernacular. He is the Senior Distinguished Poet in the Graduate Writing Program at NYU.    Idra Novey’s most recent poetry collection is Clarice: The Visitor. She is the translator of Clarice Lispector’s novel The Passion According to G.H., and teaches in the Creative Writing Program at Princeton University.    Flávia Rocha is a Brazilian writer and journalist. Her most recent poetry collection is Quartos Habitáveis, published in Brazil. She is the editor-in-chief of Rattapallax magazine.    Márcio-André is a Brazilian experimental artist with works in sound, visual poetry, installation, performance and video art. His most recent poetry book is Cazas, published in Brazil. He has taught at the University of Coimbra and at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro.        —   ​     NYU BOOKSTORE, 726 BRAODWAY          Programs Speakers Open to the Public
